project.teaser: The overall objectives of the BIOBoost project are to increase the latent potential of the participating innovation agencies, to learn from leading innovator regions, and to cement this knowledge and experience in the organisations, building and expanding networks, expanding...
project.objective:
The overall objectives of the BIOBoost project are to increase the latent potential of the participating innovation agencies, to learn from leading innovator regions, and to cement this knowledge and experience in the organisations, building and expanding networks, expanding the cooperation and enlarging the participation of more diverse innovation stakeholders and territories to existing successful initiatives in the bioeconomy, including agri-food, forestry, bio-based chemicals, materials and products, and bioenergy.
The partnership will implement a range of activities via peer-to-peer learning, including study visits and staff exchanges, to develop closer relationships within the partnership, and with the wider regional innovation ecosystems, as well as to learn improved innovation support measures. These will be cemented via operational work to build and develop innovation ecosystems and SMEs via hackathons and challenges (160 organisations involved), by providing direct SME support on innovation management (24 cross-border KAM cases), and helping widening country SMEs towards financing of innovation projects (50+ cases). Over 450 SMEs will be engaged with during the implementation of the project, which will include active cooperation with 20 other innovation ecosystems.
BIOBoost connects 7 homogenous EU regions in terms of similarities of RIS3 and S3 Platform synergies related to bioeconomy and digitalisation. The multidisciplinary partnership has been strategically selected, to work in an inclusive and interactive bottom-up process, to discover potential new activities, and identify new opportunities that emerge from this interaction. Despite the homogeneity in terms of regional smart specialisation, the consortium consists of partners with a wide variety of complementary skills and experience, covering a wide geographical area and with considerable economic, social and environmental differences.
project.title: Boosting innovation agencies for bioeconomy value chains
project.keywords: hackathons, challenges, staff exchange, study visit

article.title: Learning from Europe’s bioeconomy innovation leaders

result.title: Dissemination and communication report
result.description: The report provides information on dissemination and communication efforts, results, and provides quantitative figures for outreach.

result.title: Report and evaluation of impact from challenges
result.description: The report will include information from questionnaires created prior to the events as well as ex-post evaluations, and can be used to feed into future policymaking.

result.title: Project management handbook
result.description: The project management handbook will provide clear information on project procecures tools and timelines

result.title: Report on innovation ecosystems
result.description: The report includes information on innovation support ecosystems covering key networks and partners and environment current support programmes and activities offered by the partner and available from ecosystem partners

result.title: Data management and ethics plan
result.description: The DMP provides clear information on the consortiums handling of data used or collected in the BIOBoost project An ethics plan will provide information on the consortiums responsibilities towards key ethical issues

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - BIOBoost (Boosting innovation agencies for bioeconomy value chains)
result.teaser: The overall objectives of the BIOBoost project are to increase the latent potential of the participating innovation agencies, to learn from leading innovator regions, and to cement this knowledge and experience in the organisations, building and expanding networks, expanding...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: BIOBoost Replication Guide
result.description: The replication guide provides information to relevant organisations on how to use the results of the BIOBoost project; what works and what doesn't.

result.title: Matrix of innovation opportunities
result.description: The matrix will include possible consortia / funding opportunities for follow up and inspiration, as well as technology development needs from large companies.

result.title: Stakeholder map
result.description: Interactive online tool showing and mapping map key stakeholders across the European innovation ecosystem

result.title: Report and evaluation of impact from cross-border KAM
result.description: The report will include quantitative evaluations of the SME, supplemented by ex-ante and ex-post questionnaires and feedback from stakeholders.

result.title: Design option paper
result.description: The Design Options Paper includes the BIOBoost strategy for increasing participation of diverse stakeholders and serves as an operative roadmap for designing and implementing new supporting services, tools and resources to facilitate and expand the support provided to innovation stakeholders.

result.title: Plan for Dissemination, Exploitation and Communication (PDEC)
result.description: The PDEC provides information to all project partners on communication channels methods styles and messages

result.title: Selection criteria for SME recruitment to the programme
result.description: Assessment criteria for SMEs for potential ambition levels management support and access to sufficient resources used as part of the selection process of 70 SMEs

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
